results.title: The Journey of Natty Gann
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Mike Lobell and Jeremy Kagan
results.brief_description: America is in the depths of the Great Depression. Families are broken apart when far away jobs beckon. A courageous young girl confronts overwhelming odds when she embarks on a cross-country search for her father. During her extraordinary odyssey, she forms a close bond with a magnificent protective wolf, and a hardened drifter. Stars Meredith Salenger, John Cusack, Ray Wise, Laine Kazan.

results.title: The Journey begins at midnight
results.creator_credit: Joseph Jovic and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Josip tells of his upbringing on a farm in Coatia and how the lure of a better life brought him to Australia, Geelong and, eventually, to Brintons Carpets. Learning English within a few years, Josip soon became a shop steward and a representative on the Consultative Committee and he tells of the closure of Brintons and how it led to his retirement.

results.title: The Journey = The Voyage = El Viaje [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Cinesur, Les Films du Sud, Envar El Kadri, Djamila Olivesi and Fernando Solanas
results.brief_description: Argentinian born director Fernando Solanas began his career making short films and documentaries of a political nature before eventually seeking exile in France in 1977 after the military coup in Argentina in 1976. In 1985, he received international renown with “Tangos: the exile of Gardel” which was awarded the Special Prize of the Jury in Venice. “The Journey” (aka “The Voyage”) continues the strong political theme, albeit in a somewhat satirical way. The plot centres around 17 year-old Martin (Walter Quiroz) who sets out on his bicycle to find his long lost father, an anthropologist who was last reported as working in Brazil. His epic journey from Tierra del Fuego to Peru, the Andes highlands to the Amazon and finally to Brazil proves to be a life-changing, mind-opening experience revealing the political exploitation, environmental and cultural destruction and the sometimes absurd contradictions which exist in this unique and precious part of the world known as Latin America. Cast also includes Franklin Caicedo, Fito Paez, Carlos Carella, Ricardo Bartis, Angela Correa. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Journey (K)
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Richard Mason and Jane Oehr
results.brief_description: Twelve year old Ada lives with her father on a windswept mountain plateau, looked after by Martha, the housekeeper, and Martha’s daughter Agnes. On his deathbed, Ada’s father tells her to journey south to seek her true inheritance. But Martha, who is a witch, is determined to get to the inheritance first. She orders Agnes to follow Ada, kill her and steal her map. Agnes is unable to kill her friend and the two are drawn together on a journey for buried treasure.

results.title: The Journey's rewards
results.creator_credit: Darren Kane, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Darren Kane first travelled to India, he loved it. However, his time there set him on another journey, one that would take him around the world and deep inside himself.

results.title: The Journey
results.brief_description: An old man sits in a rowboat on an endless gravel ocean remembering episodes from his youth and middle age. The three vignettes presented in this film using model animation come to represent the old man’s search for spiritual meaning and purpose in his life. The tightrope becomes a metaphor for his precarious passage from boyhood to adulthood, while the door and ladder sequence comes to represent the man’s desire for meaning through material wealth. The final rowboat episode thus becomes the pinnacle of the man’s quest - a final search for fulfilment that will take him beyond life.

results.title: The Journey
results.brief_description: The film may be appreciated both as a complex story with many levels of meaning or as a good suspense story. A group of people in a train are as diverse as life itself, each character has a symbol, each person minds his own business oblivious to the others. During the journey the people disappear.

results.title: The Journey
results.brief_description: A quiet sensitive and beautifully photographed story of a man in middle age, who has reached a “still point” in life. Without the drive to attain the rare moments of happiness which life offers, he lapses into warm memories of a life creatively spent, inducing a sensual nostalgia which threatens to cripple him. His urban frustration takes him to an old people’s home where he gives piano lessons to the daughter of a friend. But alone, yearning for the richness and depth possible in personal relationships, his dreams become haunted by Johanna, a past love. The film can be described as a journey; not of physical life, but of the individual’s inner self moving towards a point of self-acceptance, despite life’s disappointments and increasing loss of faculties.

results.title: The Journey
results.creator_credit: Aeriel, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Patricia L'Huede and Christopher Tuckfield
results.brief_description: Based on the moving portrayal of the extraordinary journey to Japan of 74 year-old Billie Sinclair, who is deaf, blind and mute. Billie has been deaf since the age of two and lost his sight at age ten, but despite this he is a dedicated traveller who funds his trips by weaving and selling baskets. The landscape of his travels is one of touch and smell, imagination and even memory, for he can still remember the time before he lost his sight as a child. This remarkable man has survived and thrived. His is not a handicap but a blessing for it has encouraged him to keep searching and learning. In Japan he rides a roller coaster, tries his hand at Judo and visits a deaf and blind acupuncturist. His world is so sensual, one almost envies it. This documentary achieves a miraculous thing; it transports those possessed of all their senses into a world where communication is by touch alone. And even more miraculously, this world does not terrify.

results.title: The Journalist
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Film Corporation, Pom Oliver and Michael Thornhill
results.brief_description: Follow the turbulent fortunes of Simon Morris, a top reporter and feature writer for a major daily newspaper. The newspaper is just a background to Simon’s lifestyle, particularly his relationship with women. Stars Jack Thompson, Elizabeth Alexander and Sam Neill.
